tests.explanation: The original and mutant programs have a different median. The original program calculates the median as the middle number from the sorted array, while the mutant program calculates it as the number at the index size/2. In the test input [1,2,3], the median is 2 in the original and 3 in the mutant.

The original and mutant programs have a different median. The original program calculates the median as the middle number from the sorted array, while the mutant program calculates it as the number at the index size/2. In the test input [4,5,6], the median is 5 in the original and 6 in the mutant.

The original and mutant programs have the same median, but the mutant program has an unnecessary and incorrect casting of the array index. The expression (i = 2) initializes the i variable to 2, which may not be a valid index in the array.
